title: Maria Duggan works on European Late Antique and early medieval archaeology, particularly focusing on late Roman and Byzantine pottery and long-distance exchange and contact. She completed her PhD research on the ceramic evidence for 5th to 7th century links between western Britain, the Atlantic Seaboard, and the Aegean and East Mediterranean at Newcastle University in 2016

title: He teaches and researches Late Antique, Byzantine and early Islamic archaeology in the Mediterranean and has a particular research interest in ceramics. He directed excavations at the early Byzantine settlement at Kilise Tepe in southern Turkey and has carried out research for excavations and surveys in Greece, Cyprus and Turkey; these include survey material from Late Roman D pottery production sites in Pisidia and ceramics from the Apalirou Environs Survey

title: Sam Turner works on medieval archaeology and the cultural heritage of landscapes, with particular interests in Britain, Europe and the Mediterranean. He has worked at Newcastle University since 2004, where he is now Professor of Archaeology and Director of the interdisciplinary McCord Centre for Landscape.
